intro: Panzeria lanata f. kansuensis, commonly known as the Kansu hairy panzeria, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant is distinguished by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
